Please note that in Python, the '%' operator is used to calculate the remainder of the division. So, 'B % A' will give the remainder when B is divided by A. If this remainder is zero, then A is a divisor of B.

 - All values in input are integers.
 - 1 \leq A \leq B \leq 20

Input is given from Standard Input in the following format:
A B

-----Output-----
If A is a divisor of B, print A + B; otherwise, print B - A.

-----Sample Input-----
4 12

-----Sample Output-----
16

As 4 is a divisor of 12, 4 + 12 = 16 should be printed.
